attributes.action: Make humira free to patients with the eye condition uvietus
attributes.background: Uvietus can make people lose their eyesight , humira is known to settle the uvietus down and stop it flaring up giving the patient a chance of getting their eyes operated on , ie cataract operation. This drug is free in Scotland and Wales but not from NHS England . Why

attributes.action: Require all local councils in England to use LED bulbs in street lights.
attributes.background: Sodium lighting is commonplace in British towns and cities. These orange lights cause a large amount of light pollution and make it difficult for most of us to see a full starry sky [1]. A switch to Amber LED lighting would improve these conditions greatly and would also be more energy efficient [2]
attributes.additional_details:
1. http://nightblight.cpre.org.uk/maps/ - The light pollution map for the UK 
2. http://www1.eere.energy.gov/buildings/publications/pdfs/alliances/outdoor_area_lighting.pdf - The American "Office of Energy Efficiency & Renewable Energy'"s report on new LED installation. 
- On the topic of Amber LED: In this case amber is the suggested colour as dimming the LEDs is the key in reducing light pollution emmisions, it also reduces blue-light exposure. http://darksky.org/lighting/led-practical-guide/

attributes.action: Give Police a power to seize vehicles of those caught driving & using mobiles
attributes.background: Following the jailing today of Tomasz Kroker for 10 years for causing the deaths of Tracey Houghton, her two sons Josh and Ethan and her stepdaughter Aimee Goldsmith, it's time this country toughened the law on using a mobile phone behind the wheel.
attributes.additional_details: Most people don't even think about it.  They answer a call, they write or read a text whilst driving, they change music tracks like Tomasz Kroker as he drove a heavy goods vehicle.  Tracey Houghton, her two sons Josh and Ethan and her stepdaughter Aimee Goldsmith were on their way back from a holiday when they were killed instantly.  You have probably seen the moving video of their relatives describing the aftermath.  Sign this petition in their memory & for radical change.

attributes.action: Ban the taking of photographs of children in school without the child's consent
attributes.background: The concept of private life is a broad one which encompasses the right to identity.  A pupil's image reveals his or her unique characteristics and constitutes one of the chief attributes of his or her personality.
attributes.additional_details: A child, over the age of 12, must be able to give or withdraw consent to the taking of his or her images in addition to the wishes and feelings of the parents/legal guardians.  At present, there are guidelines published by the Information Commissioners Office as to the taking of photographs at schools.  We argue that this is not sufficient because the use of personal mobile phones within a class room setting by a tutor is not prohibited.

attributes.action: Establish a 7 day celebration of tireless efforts by NHS workers 365 days a year
attributes.background: My mum recently attended Hospital for a hip replacement where she was cared for by many wonderful NHS workers over a five day period including a weekend. I felt that my few words of appreciation to the staff needed reinforcing through a national campaign aimed at thanking all NHS workers in the UK.

attributes.action: Prevent privatisation of any aspect of Children's Protective Services in the UK
attributes.background: Children deserve to be protected by a system that is not privately controlled and therefore accountable to shareholders. Children's Protective Services must remain within Local Authority control as a Statutory Duty to protect children from avoidable harm.
attributes.additional_details:
Privitisation may allow confused prioritIes for providers that could lead to vulnerable children being abused.

We all have a duty to safeguard children which is a public necessity not a private and financial one.

attributes.action: Stop BT having the monopoly on installing phone lines so other providers can.
attributes.background: As consumers in this day and age we should be able to have options to use a company for a service or not. BT have not been able to provide myself and others on the estate with a phone line or internet services, myself since June 2016 others longer than 8 months
attributes.additional_details: some of the residents including myself on the estate have gone down the complaints route to the CEO and it's still not been resolved and no foreseeable dates for a resolution either. Only BT install phone lines then rent them to other providers. There is literally nothing any of us have been able to do. Every week we chase for an update to be told it's still being looked at. No dates no resolution and no phone line and Internet

attributes.action: Stop councils selling off hundreds of our school's playing fields ! #WeSayNO
attributes.background:
Please see TES article link below for shocking details and sign & share this petition #WeSayNo #EnoughIsEnough 

https://www.tes.com/news/school-news/breaking-news/exclusive-councils-sell-hundreds-acres-school-playing-field-land

attributes.action: Ban Diesel Vehicles from City Centers
attributes.background:
This Monday pollution levels in areas of the UK were higher than in parts of Beijing, China.

Diesel vehicles produce 80% of this pollution and cars produce 10x the same pollution from trucks and busses.

I call upon the government to introduce a ban on these vehicles from city centers.
attributes.additional_details:
The ban should be implemented by 2018 as part of the government plan to fight pollution due in April.

The fine should be 10x the current value of the car tax for that vehicle class plus interest. Considerations should be made for the age of the vehicle and the level of pollution so that dirtier cars are more heavily penalised.

 Buses should be mandated to be petrol hybrid or electric and trucks may have an exemption during off-peak hours but companies should be forced to pay an emissions tax.

attributes.action: Save Dunelm House (Durham Uni student union), by giving it Grade II listing.
attributes.background: The Secretary of State has refused an application from Historic England for Grade II listing. The granting of a Certificate of Immunity is now being considered with the intention that the building be demolished. We would like the Secretary to reconsider Grade II listing status.
attributes.additional_details:
It won both a Civic Trust award and the RIBA Bronze Medal 1966. The building has subsequently been praised many times. It needs to be saved as a key piece of architectural herritage. 

Catherine Croft, Director of C20 Society: “We consider Dunelm House to be a remarkably intact survivor of its era...  ...We are extremely disappointed that the Minister has chosen to disregard the view of her heritage advisers (Historic England) and the Society in making this decision.”

attributes.action: Stop Govia Thameslink( GTR) from being allowed to increase fares in 2017
attributes.background:
Govia Thameslink the owners of Southern Rail have consistently failed to provide a service which could be considered acceptable in any reasonable way. 
With both individuals and businesses losing millions they should not be allowed to raise fares when they are not providing a proper service.
attributes.additional_details:
With well documented proof that they have consistently failed to provide a proper service, have left passengers stranded and have cost individuals & businesses millions in lost revenue collectively the owners of Southern Rail should have no automatic right to increase fares when they have failed miserably to provide an acceptable service for the last 8 months of 2016. 

This issue has been raised in the house several times and is public knowledge.

attributes.action: Initiate a Parliamentary Inquiry into the UK Insurance Industry
attributes.background:
The UK Insurance Industry operates under practices which are in direct contrast to the interests of its customers.
Involving multiple entities in any single claim increases costs which are passed on to the policy holder's insurer.  
Cases are settled to avoid costs in spite of no fault situations
attributes.additional_details:

attributes.action: Owners of UK newspapers must be British citizens
attributes.background: Newspapers have enormous influence in UK politics, but the biggest of them are not owned by British citizens. They have power without being real stakeholders in society.  Those seeking to influence UK politics and opinion should actually be citizens who will have to live with the results.

attributes.action: Raise pay for regular and reserve armed forces personnel
attributes.background: Our armed forces are underpaid and over worked we think that there minimum pay should be raised not just for regulars but also reserve units aswell
attributes.additional_details: I am an ex regular soldier and a serving reserve soldier in the army and I've seen first hand the state some of my muckers have been in having to budget for everything while risking there life if needs must to protect the uk and her inhabitants

attributes.action: Ban Sodium Fluoride from our tap water
attributes.background: Sodium Fluoride is not natural, it is man made. Do not get this mixed up with calcium fluoride which is natural and can be found in soil. Sodium fluoride has not been scientificly tested for long term affects or if it even helps prevent tooth decay like we get told it does.
attributes.additional_details: Fluoride has been seen to cause alot of diseases such as cancer. https://fluoridealert.org/issues/health/ check it out for yourselves via the link above. Sodium fluoride is mostly found in the pineal gland after being indigested, which leads to a lowered IQ of the person consuming it. Unfortunately, the damaged caused by sodium fluoride can not be reversed. However we can stop making it worse and avoid the affects by stopping drinking it everyday in our tap water.

attributes.action: Make Politics a mandatory subject for the primary curriculum.
attributes.background: Elections in the US and the recent Brexit vote demonstrate key decisions that the people need to have a good background in Politics to vote on. Giving an education promotes this exploration of politics earlier than just 6 months before a referendum/election. Students can make up their own mind.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.populus.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Remain-and-leave-1.png

http://www.populus.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Remain-and-leave-2.png

People need the chance to have an educated vote, not voting on personality or party without understanding.

attributes.action: Change Immigration rules for non eu partners.
attributes.background:
Get rid of the financial requirements so that non eu partners can able to stay and work in the uk.
The only requirements need to be married or have a family with british national.
However, both of them can not claim any benefits or funds for 2 years.
attributes.additional_details:
I am british and married with japanese national.  My spouse can not stay and work in the uk because we can not  meet financial requirements. 
It's very unfair system for british national with non eu partners.

attributes.action: Make University fee's cheaper for over seas students and free for UK citizens.
attributes.background: Make University fee's cheaper for over seas students and free for UK citizens. This will allow more students to have the opportunity to get a degree and be able to apply for the best jobs.

attributes.action: Urgently review age-based referrals for breast cancer screening women under 30.
attributes.background:
Under 30's automatically considered as non-urgent referral of up to 3 months.

Over 30's can expect to be seen within days/weeks.

Both can have same symptoms. 

This needs to change.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.edinburghnews.scotsman.com/news/health/mum-with-breast-cancer-urges-women-to-trust-their-instincts-1-4089771

https://www.gofundme.com/breastiesin20s

attributes.action: Stop KS1/KS2 SATS criteria discriminating against children with special needs
attributes.background: Current KS1/KS2 SATS criteria state that a child who does not write in the approved way can only be assessed as ‘working towards’ or ‘working at expected’ standards; they cannot be 'working at greater depth’. This discriminates against children with special needs who are unable to write 'joined up'.
attributes.additional_details:
There are no exclusion criteria for children who are unable to write 'joined up', whether because of visual impairment, motor or coordination problems affecting the arms, dyslexia, or other special need.

Full information on the regulations can be found in the Standards & Testing Agency document ‘Clarification: key stage 1 and 2 teacher assessment and moderation guidance’ published in March 2016, downloadable at: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/clarification-key-stage-1-and-2-teacher-assessment-and-moderation-guidance

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory fortification of milk and other foodstuffs with Vitamin D.
attributes.background:
Finding tasty foods that are high in Vitamin D is a challenging task.

The majority of the UK population suffers from Vitamin D deficiencies. 
Government must act to prevent the continuing rise in bone diseases such as rickets through mandatory Vitamin D food fortification, as in USA and Canada.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the BBC "Vitamin D deficiency is likely to affect over half the UK's white population, up to 90% of the multi-ethnic population and a quarter of all children living in Britain."

The British Medical Journal recently published a journal saying fortifying foods with Vitamin D (adding Vitamin D to food) would reduce the risk of illness and improve bone and muscle health.

The SACN has also urged an increase in the RDA of Vitamin D to 10 µg/day (400 IU/d), throughout the year.

attributes.action: Make changes to the child maintenance service
attributes.background: make it a legal requirement that the paying parent must sign on unemployment benefits within 5 working days if claiming to be unemployed or supported by family. The law needs to change so parents cannot avoid paying child support. They should not be able to avoid child support
attributes.additional_details: It is far too easy for the paying parent to avoid paying child support. If the parent states they are being supported by family then the family should be responsible for paying the child support. If stating unemployed they should be forced to sign on and actively looking for work.

attributes.action: Prevent the UK defence from becoming useless, fulfil the NATO pledge of 2%
attributes.background: To be spending less than 2 per cent of GDP on defence is utterly unacceptable, particularly in this time of immense global uncertainty.
attributes.additional_details: The IISS said Britain’s defence spending had dipped below the NATO benchmark figure, despite the government vowing to meet the target. However has continued its campaign of unnecessary cuts to defence by selling of well-established bases weakening the defence of the nation. This is a great error in judgement as fails generations of hard work in building our defence to be the best it can be in the modern era.

attributes.action: reinstate b+e entitlement on all driving licences after 1st Jan 1997.
attributes.background:
Allow drivers since 1st January 1997 to be able legally tow a trailer upto 3500kg.
Current legislation is costly to the user and stops the independence of many hobbies.

attributes.action: Approve an Independence Referendum if the Scottish Parliament votes to call one.
attributes.background: The Scottish Government was elected on a promise to hold a second Independence Referendum should Scotland be taken out of the EU against the will of its people. As a result of the Brexit Vote, Westminster must not impede the Scottish Parliament if it votes to call a second Independence Referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
Both Theresa May and Sir Michael Fallon have stated that there is no need for a second Independence Referendum during the current parliament, which runs to 2020. 

It must be the Scottish Parliament, as the elected representatives of the Scottish people, who make decisions on Scotland's future. 

The Scottish Parliament must have the freedom to call a second Independence Referendum, and decide Scotland's future relationship with the EU, and the rest of the world.

attributes.action: Make it a Criminal Offence to Teach a Fitness Class without a Qualification
attributes.background:
This Law will make sure that Fitness Instructors have knowledge of Anatomy and Physiology before teaching a Fitness or wellbeing class.
It will also help our battle against the obesity rate in the UK.
If not the risk will increase of participants getting injured and less will achieve results.
attributes.additional_details:
Poll i conducted on my Facebook Group Fitness Professionals Association.
Do you think you should have Pre-requisite qualifications like ETM or Level 2 to attend a Les Mills or Zumba initial training course?

Totally agree 110
Don't agree  6
Maybe 1

attributes.action: Get the uk goverment to give a larger budget for uk road maintenance
attributes.background: Years of underfunding has left uk roads in a severely poor state, leaving them dangerous in areas

attributes.action: Make children and young people in care's funding go up to the age of 21!
attributes.background: People who have been through the care system will understand....The need for support at 18 years old but none being accessible because there is no funding. We need to fight to change this!

attributes.action: No tolls on Mersey Gateway or Jubilee bridges for Halton residents.
attributes.background: Tolls on local bridges will cost Halton residents £1000 per year and will divide Runcorn and Widnes.
attributes.additional_details: This was reported by BBC North West news on Thursday 26th of January.

attributes.action: The UK Government must commit to publicly destroying all stockpiled ivory.
attributes.background: Between 2009 and 2014, 40% of all illegal wildlife seizures made by the UK’s Border Force were ivory items. In 2015, 110kg of ivory were captured at Heathrow airport in one of the UK’s largest seizures of illegal ivory. We call on the UK Government to commit to destroying any stockpiles of ivory.
attributes.additional_details: Publicly destroying ivory stockpiles will raise awareness that the $20bn annual illegal wildlife trade is the 4th largest global illegal activity. This action will send a clear message to the world that the UK will not tolerate illegal trafficking and commercial trade in any raw or worked ivory and that we support a near total ban on domestic ivory trade. Most importantly, it will emphasise to current and future generations that ivory is worthless unless it is on wild living elephants.

attributes.action: Take military action against the Syrian President Bashar al-Assad's Government.
attributes.background: 3 years ago, Parliament rejected a Gov. motion to take action against the Syrian Gov., after receiving evidence of the use of Chemical weapons against the Syrian people. We ask Parliament to reconsider its position following more recent reports of war crimes, including summary killings of civilians.
attributes.additional_details: In 2013, the UN confirmed that the Syrian Government had used chemical weapons against the Syrian people. In recent days there have been increased concerns that the Syrian army and their military supporters are committing both humanitarian and war crimes, including the massacring of families in cold blood. We urge Parliament to approve military action, in order to help in relieving Syrian civilians of their plight, and to deter the Syrian Government from committing such crimes against them.

attributes.action: Send aid and health trained volunteers into Aleppo to help with current crisis.
attributes.background: Aleppo deserves help, we have already turned our backs once before by making it clear England doesn't want refugees, bombing needs to stop. There is no hospitals left. It's a human rights violation. send them aid- medicine, shelter, food, drink, clothes and volunteers trained in health care
attributes.additional_details: Every single day people are dying in Aleppo. Watch the news

attributes.action: Continue the Rail Electrification Works between Cardiff and London via Bristol
attributes.background:
On 8th November, it has been reported that electrification works on the railways between Cardiff and London via Bristol, among other works, will be arbitrarily and indefinitely delayed from the previous schedule.

This is an insult to the people of Bristol, Wales and the South West.
attributes.additional_details:
"Costly and disruptive electrification works" have already been underway in Bristol and the Severn Tunnel. To delay capitalizing on the progress that has already been made is to ask the region to absorb the economic penalties from those works without view of payback in improved service.

We urge the minister Paul Maynard to honour his party's manifesto pledge, reconsider this decision and continue with the works as planned.

https://goo.gl/IpVbRY

https://goo.gl/osNOoe

attributes.action: Change the Postal Voting System
attributes.background:
The postal voting system is wide open to abuse
There have been numerous examples of postal voter fraud in our country.
We believe that postal votes should only be available to our Armed Forces, people who are ill or who are on holiday
Also make photo ID at polling stations mandatory

attributes.action: Raise teachers' pay
attributes.background: Teachers are the backbone of society and there would be no future without them. Yet they so undervalued and undermined within society and do not receive a high enough wage.

attributes.action: Ban Kirpans (ceremonial dagger) in primary schools
attributes.background: My children's primary school has just announced that they have passed a policy allowing children (aged 4 upwards) to wear a Kirpan if they have taken promises under Amrit.
attributes.additional_details: To me, a dagger is a dagger and has absolutely no place in a primary school.  I would like to see the Goverment review the situation and bring a complete ban on Kirpans in primary schools, as despite the policies in place, I do not feel happy allowing my children to be in an environment where other children are carrying daggers or knives.

attributes.action: The UK government must condemn the Ethiopian government's treatment of the Oromo
attributes.background: We believe that the UK government should stop enabling the Ethiopian government and that they should support calls for an international, and independent investigation into the treatment of the Oromo people. Most recently this has lead to the death of 23 Oromo prisoners in a fire.
attributes.additional_details:
The Oromo people are the largest ethnic group in Ethiopia and make up 40% of the population. They have experienced discrimination at the hands of the government which has been dominated by the minority ethnic group Tigray for decades. 

The situation in Ethiopia has become increasingly unstable since security forces repeatedly fired upon protests in the Amhara and Oromia regions in August 2016. 

For more info: https://www.hrw.org/news/2016/09/08/joint-letter-un-human-rights-council-ethiopia

attributes.action: Ban the sale and distribution of single-use plastic drinks bottles in the UK
attributes.background: Billions of single-use plastic drinks bottles are sold each year in the UK. Too many of these end up on our beaches and in our oceans, where they harm marine and bird life life. This can be avoided by using less damaging alternatives such as aluminium cans, cardboard cartons and glass.

attributes.action: Re-evaluate the Council House Programme
attributes.background: We need to re-evaluate the Council House Programme as Council houses should only be available to those in desperate need of local support and/or because they are facing homelessness (as long as they haven't made themselves intentionally homeless)
attributes.additional_details: Council houses should only be available to those in desperate need of local support and/or because they're facing homelessness and then when they're back on their feet and are able to afford to either private rent or get a mortgage, the council should assist them with this, & then this council house can then be made available again for those who really need it. (Also need a large nationwide building programme to reimburse the council House stock, & until then the Right To Buy should be stopped)

attributes.action: Raise £9 billion a year to fund the disastrous shortfall in the NHS
attributes.background:
The Kings Fund predicts an £8 billion a year shortfall to NHS funding by 2020/21. No government wants to deal with this deficit by raising income tax. 

A 2p in the pound rise in income tax would raise approx £9 billion a year.
This money could be 'ringfenced' for sole use by the NHS

attributes.action: We would like to get Creative Writing reinstated as an A- Level qualification
attributes.background: In 2018, the last exams of A-Level Creative Writing will run. This is  because the Department of Education and OFQUAL say that it doesn't meet their guidance and Nicky Morgan and Gove argue that it is not 'Academic' enough. We want to show them how academic it really is and show them why it matters.
attributes.additional_details: We want to argue against this. Michael Rosen said How about cutting art from art?. The government says that Creative Writing is too vocational yet they don't know how academic it really is.Otherwise why would it be offered at university? Furthermore, they want more 'academic' subjects such as English Literature to prove their worth but many teenagers find this difficult due to much writing being written in the elaborated code which puts children from a working class background at a disadvantage.

attributes.action: Ban Dustbin lorries from operating between the school-run and rush hours
attributes.background: Dustbin lorries are a major obstruction during school-run and rush hours. it causes chaos and leads to workers and children being late at school/work and should be banned during the hours of 8:30am-9:30am working days
attributes.additional_details: We all know the frustration first thing in the morning when you rushing to work or dropping off your children at school and being stuck 20-30 minutes and then get the telling off! why are you late again? So we are asking throughout this one hour that they should operate only in main roads.

attributes.action: Make the government provide the funding that the NHS and social care need
attributes.background: The NHS and social care under the conservatives has taken huge cuts. This has put huge strain on the NHS with the Red Cross deeming it a "humanitarian crisis". People are dying waiting on trolleys in hospital for beds that are not available.
attributes.additional_details: People are waiting up to 12 hours to be seen in A&E, when the target is four hours. Old people spend weeks in hospital beds as there is no social care to treat them at home. People's lives are at risk and the conservative government are doing nothing about it. I hearby call that PM Theresa May and health secretary Jeremy Hunt provide the funding that is desperately needed. This demands action and it needs it now. We cannot put people's lives at risk, this is not acceptable. They must act now.

attributes.action: I want  to create a law to neuter domestic pets except for registered breeders.
attributes.background: Hundreds and thousands of pet animals are slaughtered as there are not enough homes. I have volunteered in pet rescue for  years and its now  worse as peoples lifestyle and priorities in 21st century have changed. Cruelty and neglect are commonplace. Reduce the numbers humanely stop them being born.
attributes.additional_details: Rescue centres are being swamped with unwanted pets They are turning away animals that vets are having to destroy just because they are no longer wanted or cannot be afforded  A law that all domestic animals are neutered unless bred by legislated breeders could stop the puppy farms, and cruelty and neglect by ignorance and greed of casual breeding, and these innocent creatures of all ages could have loving homes  Check the websites of animal charities to see the levels of neglect and euthanasia

attributes.action: Introduce rent caps on private let & prevent landlords refusing Housing Benefit
attributes.background: Currently in the SE private rents have become ridiculous, with  a single room costing as much as £700 pm. This is useless to a largely working class area. To add to this most letting agents and landlords refuse to accept any form of housing benefit, even as a top up.
attributes.additional_details: I would as that we stop the practice of refusing to accept tenants with housing benefit and ask that we put caps on how much rent can be charged. £1400 pm for a house is impossibly high! This requires you to be earning £34,000 and pay almost £3000 up front (figures on a recent viewing of a property) The average UK wage of £26,500 would not cover this. We have houses. People simply cannot afford them! I would also ask they they stop houses being split into rooms for rental reducing family homes.

attributes.action: Make FREE  temporary housing provisions for the homeless and support accessible
attributes.background: I want the government to make FREE temporary housing provisions available and accessible throughout the UK and give our homeless support to find permanent housing, lifestyles support such as counselling so they can regain a functioning position within society again
attributes.additional_details: More and More homeless are appearing on the streets of the UK, some have lost everything and have nowhere to turn so do the best they can by sleeping on the streets and begging , some are war veterans who have fought then been cast to one side as they as if a person is expendable, so turn to drugs and alcohol to fade out the pain. Homelessness is not normal and these people need support and not to be cast aside, ignored, left to freeze to death on the street or forced into crime to survive.

attributes.action: 25 Year Old and over to pay less than £2000 on car insurance
attributes.background: Over 25s should be paying less car insurance as they are unlikely to cause accidents by showing off on the roads they are more wiser and with more experience.

attributes.action: Provide free prescriptions for those suffering lifelong / incurable conditions
attributes.background: It is unfair that people who have no other option but to take medication for the rest of their lives, due to suffering from lifelong / incurable diseases, conditions or syndromes (such as: arthritis, asthma, heart conditions, etc.) have to pay for their prescriptions until they reach the age of 60.
attributes.additional_details:
Insulin for diabetes sufferers is free, so medication for ALL incurable diseases should also be free of charge.

Hard working tax payers who suffer from such conditions, have to pay for their prescriptions, whereas citizens on JSA can get theirs free of charge. This simply does not make sense.

£8.40 may not seem expensive, but when you are being prescribed 4 different medications per month for the same condition, this amounts to over £400 per year without a pre-paid exemption card.

attributes.action: Increase the standard paid length of Paternity Leave in the UK to 4 weeks.
attributes.background:
I have recently completed 2 weeks Paternity Leave after my first child was born. 
It really isn't enough time, the time it takes to properly bond with your child is vastly beyond what is currently allowed. 
It should be totally optional but I believe the government should increase the paid time.

attributes.action: Reduce fuel VAT to 5%
attributes.background: As energy VAT is at 5%; fuel such as petrol and diesel should also be reduced to 5% as they are also non-renewable energy sources.
